content:
What part of syncronised have you missed. The server is considered canonical in that process so if there is nothing on the server any update to local profiles from a backup to put the mails back will immediately see them deleted to match the server.

If you have a copy of the files (the inbox etc files from the Thunderbird profile, copy them to a USN drive.

Install the importexport tools add-on in Thunderbird and import from those files to local folders. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/?src=ss

You can later try and copy the individual email from local folders to the gmail account, but it will be slow anf gmail will fight you all the way. batches not exceeding 500 email is probably the most you can copy at a time and remember there is a daily bandwidth limit on gmail so if you previously had a large store you may find many days of using the daily limit are required to move things back to where they used to be,
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
and yet I hasve exactly that, a highlight of the selected message. But the colours usaed in those are directly derived from the operating system and most folk that report these types of error do not use a default operating system theme.

Check in Thunderbird themes and try the light and dark themes as opposed to the default theme which is the one that listens to the operating system for the highlight colour.

content: Does the same issue happen if you restart Thunderbird via Help > Troubleshoot Mode...?
creator: Mapenzi

content:
OK, that worked, now how do I find out what caused the problem with the selected message highlight?

creator: fhkolwicz1

content:
If you have installed add-ons in Thunderbird one of them might be the culprit: Disable all add-ons, enable them again one by one (or two by two if there are many) and restart TB each time to verify if the issue has gone or not.

When this doesn't help restart TB in troubleshoot mode, check ✔︎ "Reset toolbars and controls" in the Troubleshoot Mode dialogue box and click "Make Changes and Restart" If the issue still persists you may have created a userChrome.css file within a chrome folder in the Thunderbird profile folder: verify by opening the profile folder via Help < Troubleshooting Information > Profile Folder > Open Folder ....

For further information about Troubleshoot Mode ( formerly "safe mode") see https://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_Mode
creator: Mapenzi

content:
OK, I tried all that and what I'm left with is this: I can have the highlighted open message in Troubleshoot Mode or I can have any extension (turning Troubleshoot off), but not both. As soon as I go back to normal mode after following all the previous directions, I lose the highlighting. Something else is the problem.

Frank
creator: fhkolwicz1

content:
Frank Kolwicz said
Something else is the problem.

Go to this SUMO help article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird and carefully read the paragraph "The problem no longer happens in Troubleshoot Mode" This is the key to success, I cannot do it for you since I neither know whether you have installed add-ons nor which theme you're using, nor whether you have created a userChrome.css file in your TB profile.

Just a hint: restart TB in troubleshoot mode, when the "Thunderbird Troubleshoot Mode" dialogue box opens check "✔︎ Reset toolbars and controls", then "Make changes and Restart" If this doesn't help change the theme and/or disable all add-ons then re-enable them one by one and test every time whether a selected message is highlighted.
creator: Mapenzi

content:
I found 3 profiles in the list and changed to the original "default" profile and things look good with the one extension I like to have.

content:
You use telstra and expect a sane and reasonable process. I stopped using their email decades ago (perhaps only one) just as I stopped using their hopelessly incompetent support line. Neither actually worked as advertised and to make matters worse the support folk were in total ignorance of anything that was not in the script they read from and having matter elevated to level two support where folk that actually knew what email was worked generally took a complaint to the ombudsman.

Zero real support from the telstra support line. I used to just end up fighting with them as the fumbled and transferred me yet again to someone else in the hope of loosing the call and generally made me aware that I was not in control and they had not idea who actually was and cared even less.

I think I recall a recent change to their service where they changed all of their server settings for old bigpond accounts to use telstra branded servers. So let's start with you advising what settings you have in account settings for incoming and outgoing server (SMTP) and we can compare them to those published by telstra here https://www.telstra.com.au/support/email/imap-pop-smtp-mail-server-settings

Proton mail non è accessibile da Thunderbird ne da nessun altro client di posta per scelta della stessa Proton.

content: This is a windows issue, not a thunderbird one. This message usually appears when you're trying to copy files from a drive formatted with NTFS to a drive formatted with FAT or FAT32, as these formats do not support certain file properties. You can either skip the message and continue copying, or format the USB drive to NTFS to avoid this issue in the future.

content:
that is generic login failure dialog. Thunderbird did not forget the server refused. Two quite different tings.

My first reaction is what has changed with century link. do your settings in Thunderbird match those published by century link. https://www.centurylink.com/home/help/internet/email/how-to-set-up-your-email-server-settings-to-go-through-pop-and-smtp.html#server-settings

Has there been some sort of outage at centurylink involving mail?

Do you have a VPN which hides your connection via certurylink from their servers that might cause them to refuse to allow you to login (it is more common these days, both providers refusing mail access unless you use their ISP services and VPN's that just turn themselves on randomly.)

content: whenever the server becomes unavailable or is having problems, this is the error you will get. It will clear when it is resolved. centurylink has many problems. It used to be my ISP, but I got tired of the errors. Especially when their server went south and they refused to move my account to a different server after telling me they were not sure when they would replace the server. You would think your account would float to whatever servers were the backups to that server automatically. After more than a month of no email, I left them for good. There's a reason at work we used to call them centurystink.
creator: jsteifel

content:
Just to be brief: This is the help forum, intended to assist users who are having problems. On the start page of Thunderbird is a button with words "Get Help." When users click there, it brings them here. And, if users don't see that button and follow customary approach that is common with many software products and click the Help>about link, that also has the menu link for Help. Yes, this is the official forum for providing assistance.

To give recommendations for improvements, the start page has a button titled "Participate.' Clicking that brings up a page where users can click to the connect.mozilla.org page and the IDEAS section where recommendations can be posted. Developers do read these suggestions. I encourage you to follow that route to ensure your proposed restructuring of forums receives attention.

Thank you for your feedback. To my knowledge as a volunteer, I am not aware of any page designed for user/developer dialogue.
creator: davidsk

content:
> I'm not sure if this is supposed to be the official place to get help if you have problems with your Thunderbird install.

creator: wsmwk

content:
While you are here look at top for "Ask a Question > Thunderbird" where you get introduced to the KB articles for desktop Thunderbird and if you still want to post a thread then look to right on that page to see the Ask a Question for the form to create a thread as you did. Also if you are viewing a thread in Thunderbird section there is a Ask a Question form link at top of the sidebar on right.

Mozilla has made this custom software for the community support forums and Knowledge Base to work together. They also have the https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/forums/ which is for discussing things related to the support.mozilla.org site.

This https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/ has been around since oh 2007 for desktop Firefox before other products got added and it was about February 21, 2014 that this became the official place for Thunderbird users to get support since as it was previously on Getsatisfaction.

Oh and one nice thing about this custom forum software is it is not vulnerable to any automated forum software spam tools like phpBB forums can be for example. We do get spam attempts though it is manually posted and we have a SumoBot that catches almost all of the spam hence why spam is rarely seen in public now for both replies and threads.

content:
I love typeing this stuff multiple times because this forum is just failing to deliver. So This wiull probably not be anything like a polite as my first text.

Your second alphabetical issue is an open bug, but the change was not some accident. It was deliberate change. Bug 2000453 has been opened regarding the change to sorting https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2000453

The primary issue of notifications from the Windows notification center is simple. Go to the notification center (windowskey+N) and determine what the text of the message is. This is exactly the same sort of thing my wife iphone does when she gets message, it shows who the message is from and replaces the message with the word private. I guess windows is also doing exactly the same thing. It is probably some message about how many new email you got. but you need to start using the notifications center as if is at the core of windows notifications. The days of popups in applications telling you when things happen are numbered and most of Thunderbird's notification have already been converted to the new standard.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thanks for helping me learn about Windows notifications. I found the source of the issue but have to ask why did it start doing this ? This was not the case for many years that I have used Thunderbird. And the notification refers to ESR which makes no sense since my version is on the release channel and ESR is typically something businesses use (based on some research I did). I can turn it off and will do that but something triggered it so this may be a bug because if I have it others probably will too and you may hear from them as well.

As far as the "recent destinations" sort issue, I have to tell you that I am disappointed with the explanation. I have worked in IT for a short while and have always marveled at how many times something is changed in a system that makes it worse and not better: i.e. used to be one click and now it's multiple clicks. Perhaps it was a "bug" for someone, but realistically it now takes longer to search and find a recent destination for me since it is no longer alphabetical. The difference is only notable for those of us that move messages to folders daily like me. I don't expect to have this changed back and will have to adjust but maybe it could be a best practice to look at bugs more closely to review their impact before resolving them. Sorry for bending your ear with my rant. I meant no disrespect to what you do. I hope you have a Merry Christmas. I'll make another donation to the cause the next time you're fund raising to show my gratitude.
creator: romcinsam

How about some details to work with. You want clues we need information.

Starting with what is the domain? Is it correctly configured in DNS to send and receive mail? Try your site in this website to see if it is all setup correctly. https://intodns.com/

I am more than a little confused by the statement "It seems to pick up my domain level email with my server, which is not what I use." you are going to have to go into some specifics I think. what exactly are you trying to set up The wizard makes some assumptions, but mostly it relies on DNS to detect the mail server. Having said that there is a manual configuration for just those occasions as when it assumes an incorrect server domain.
